intro: Psychotria loniceroides, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Coca bush," is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring simple, alternate, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is notable for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as cocaine.
